info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 10:52PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN BRADLEY... SOUTHEASTERN MARION AND HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EST/1145 PM CST/... At 1152 PM EST/1052 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lookout Mountain, or 8 miles west of Chattanooga, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Ridgeside, South Cleveland, Fairmount, and Harrison. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST/200 AM CST/ for east Tennessee.
